meta_description: The Farnsworth Art Museum offers a nationally recognized collection of works from many of America’s greatest artists, with 20,000 square feet of gallery space and over 15,000 works in the collection. It has one of the largest public collections of works by sculptor Louise Nevelson, while its Wyeth Center features works of N.C., Andrew and Jamie Wyeth.
hours_text:
## Welcome to the Farnsworth!

Founded as a bequest of Lucy Copeland Farnsworth, the Farnsworth Museum of Art opened its doors in 1948. Today, the Farnsworth is recognized as one of the best American art collections in the nation and is home to more than 15,000 works by 1,300 artists and two historic sites – the Farnsworth Homestead and the Olson House. [**See what’s on display now!**](https://www.farnsworthmuseum.org/exhibitions/)

## **** Museum Admission

**Members**|  Free  
---|---  
**Adults**|  $20  
**Seniors** 65 and over| $18  
**Students** 17 and older| $10  
**Children** 16 and under| Free  
**Rockland Residents**|  Free  
  
_The tickets are not date-specific, you may purchase your ticket and redeem it within one year._

[BUY TICKETS](http://6866.blackbaudhosting.com/6866/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=1b87ef14-b89d-4a5c-803f-79124cc2bcd8)

### _Please note: The museum is wheelchair accessible_

Please let us know how we can make your visit more accessible.

# Museum Hours

### January 1 – May 24

Open Wednesday through Sunday, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Closed Mondays and Tuesdays. Open Memorial Day

### May 25 – September 30

Open Wednesday through Monday, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Closed Tuesdays.

### October 1 – December 31

Open Wednesday through Monday, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Closed Tuesdays.

# Museum Store, 365 Gallery and 365 Design Store Hours

### January 1 – May 24

Open Wednesday through Monday, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Closed Tuesdays.

### May 25 – September 30

accessibility_text:
Farnsworth Art Museum is committed to making the information on our website accessible to all visitors, including people with disabilities. We follow current best practices and strive to adhere to W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA.

If you have difficulty accessing any of the content on our website, or have any suggestions on accessibility improvements, you may contact us using one of the methods below. Please be sure to let us know what the accessibility issue is, as well as any assistive technology you use. We’ll be happy to provide the content in a different format, if possible.

**By Phone:** 207.596.645

**By Email:** Use the form below.

* * *

Accessibility

Name *

Email Address *

Phone Number *

Comments 

Submit

If you are human, leave this field blank.

collections_text:
## CELEBRATING MAINE’S ROLE IN AMERICAN ART

The Farnsworth Art Museum offers a nationally recognized collection of works from many of America’s greatest artists, with 20,000 square feet of gallery space and over 15,000 works in the collection. It has one of the largest public collections of works by sculptor Louise Nevelson, while its Wyeth Center features works of N.C., Andrew and Jamie Wyeth. The National Register-listed Farnsworth Homestead; the Olson House, a National Historic Landmark; and the Gamble Center for Education complete the complex.

[Our History](https://issuu.com/farnsworthmuseum/docs/fam_timeline?fr=sNDQ2MzE0MTk5NDI)

The National Register-listed Farnsworth Homestead; the Olson House, a National Historic Landmark; and the Gamble Center for Education complete the complex.

[Our History](https://issuu.com/farnsworthmuseum/docs/fam_timeline?fr=sNDQ2MzE0MTk5NDI)
